voxatrace/com.musicmuni.voxatrace.calibra/CalibraLiveEval

CalibraLiveEval

class CalibraLiveEval : AutoCloseable

Real-time singing evaluation session with segment support.

What is Live Evaluation?

Live evaluation scores a singer's performance in real-time by comparing their pitch to a reference melody. Use it for:

  • Karaoke apps: Score singing as users perform

  • Music education: Provide instant feedback on pitch accuracy

  • Practice apps: Track improvement across attempts

The session breaks a song into segments (phrases or sections), evaluates each one, and tracks the user's progress.

When to Use

ScenarioUse This?Why
Score singing against referenceYesCore use case
Just detect pitch (no scoring)NoUse CalibraPitch.createDetector()
Analyze recorded audio (not live)NoUse CalibraMelodyEval
Voice activity detection onlyNoUse CalibraVAD

Quick Start

Kotlin

// 1. Create detector and session
val detector = CalibraPitch.createDetector()
val session = CalibraLiveEval.create(lessonMaterial, detector = detector)

// 2. Prepare (loads reference, extracts features)
session.prepare()

// 3. Start segment and feed audio
session.beginSegment(0)
recorder.audioBuffers.collect { buffer ->
    session.addAudio(buffer.toFloatArray(), sampleRate = 48000)
}

// 4. Get result
val result = session.endSegmentEarly()
println("Score: ${result?.score}")

// 5. Cleanup
session.close()
Content copied to clipboard

Swift

// 1. Create detector and session
let detector = CalibraPitch.companion.createDetector()
let session = CalibraLiveEval.companion.create(
    reference: lessonMaterial,
    detector: detector
)

// 2. Prepare (loads reference, extracts features)
try await session.prepare()

// 3. Start segment and feed audio
session.beginSegment(index: 0)
for await buffer in recorder.audioBuffers {
    session.addAudio(samples: buffer.toFloatArray(), sampleRate: 48000)
}

// 4. Get result
if let result = session.endSegmentEarly() {
    print("Score: \(result.score)")
}

// 5. Cleanup
session.close()
Content copied to clipboard

Usage Tiers (ADR-001)

Tier 1: Convenience API (80% of users)

Pass player and recorder handles; the session coordinates everything.

Kotlin

val session = CalibraLiveEval.create(
    reference = lessonMaterial,
    detector = CalibraPitch.createDetector(),
    player = player,
    recorder = recorder
)
session.prepare()
session.onSegmentComplete { result -> showScore(result) }
session.playSegment(0)  // Seeks, plays, records, scores automatically
Content copied to clipboard

Swift

let session = CalibraLiveEval.companion.create(
    reference: lessonMaterial,
    detector: CalibraPitch.companion.createDetector(),
    player: player,
    recorder: recorder
)
try await session.prepare()
session.onSegmentComplete { result in self.showScore(result) }
session.playSegment(index: 0)
Content copied to clipboard

Tier 2: Low-Level API (15% of users)

Manually manage audio; full control over timing.

Kotlin

val session = CalibraLiveEval.create(reference, detector = detector)
session.prepare()
session.beginSegment(0)
recorder.audioBuffers.collect { buffer ->
    session.addAudio(buffer.toFloatArray(), buffer.sampleRate)
}
val result = session.endSegmentEarly()
Content copied to clipboard

Tier 3: Custom Config (5% of users)

Kotlin

val session = CalibraLiveEval.create(
    reference = lessonMaterial,
    session = SessionConfig.Builder()
        .preset(SessionConfig.PRACTICE)
        .scoreThreshold(0.6f)
        .autoAdvance(true)
        .build(),
    detector = CalibraPitch.createDetector()
)
Content copied to clipboard

Phase Progressions

  • Singalong: IDLE → SINGING → EVALUATED

  • Singafter: IDLE → LISTENING → SINGING → EVALUATED

Observe phase StateFlow for UI updates.

Platform Notes

iOS

  • Audio from recorder is typically 48kHz; addAudio() resamples internally

  • Use Swift async/await for prepare()

  • Callbacks use @ShouldRefineInSwift - prefer the Swift extension methods

Android

  • Audio from recorder is typically 44.1kHz or 16kHz

  • Use Kotlin coroutines for prepare()

  • StateFlows work naturally with Compose/LiveData

Common Pitfalls

  1. Forgetting to call prepare(): Session won't work until reference features are extracted

  2. Not closing session: Call close() to release detector and stop coroutines

  3. Wrong sample rate in addAudio: Pass the actual hardware rate; internal resampling handles the rest

  4. Using player/recorder after session closes: Session only borrows these; caller manages lifecycle

  5. Segment index out of bounds: Check segments.size before calling beginSegment()

Ownership Model (per ADR-001)

DependencyOwnershipRationale
detectorOwned - session closes itCreated specifically for this session
playerBorrowed - caller managesShared resource, UI may need direct access
recorderBorrowed - caller managesShared resource, may be reused

For pitch detection without scoring

Configuration for auto-advance, thresholds, etc.

Per-segment scoring results
